intro: Hedychium phuluangense, commonly known as the Thai ginger lily, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Hedychium phuluangense is typically found in moist, shaded environments in forested areas.
